description: Help us tell the story of Hurricane Florence by sharing your hurricane story with us.
title: Are You Preparing for Hurricane Florence? We Want to Hear From You
title_page: Are You Preparing for Hurricane Florence? We Want to Hear From You - The New York Times
text:
Evacuations are underway in coastal areas of North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia, with more than a million residents preparing to leave ahead of Hurricane Florence.
The Category 4 storm is expected to make landfall on Thursday evening. Meteorologists have issued warnings about the potential impact of high winds and life-threatening storm surges.
Many residents have been through this before: Two years ago, thousands of coastal South Carolinians evacuated as Hurricane Matthew approached. In 1996, Hurricane Fran hit the North Carolina coast, churned inland and caused more than $1 billion in losses.
[[Read our guide to the two powerful storms that are threatening opposite ends of the earth, Hurricane Florence and Typhoon Mangkhut.]]
